intro: Eriogonum kennedyi, commonly known as Kennedy's buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its clustered, showy flowers and basal leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats such as slopes and open woodlands. Its flowers, which are usually pink or red, bloom in late spring to early summer. Eriogonum kennedyi is often found in areas with well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid conditions.
